paper_abstract: We give an algorithm for constructing a connected spanning subgraphs(panner) of a wireless network modelled as a unit disk graph with nodes of irregular transmission ranges, whereby for some parameter 0 < r <= 1 the transmission range of a node includes the entire disk around the node of radius at least r and it does not include any node at distance more than one. The construction of a spanner is distributed and local in the sense that nodes use only information at their vicinity, moreover for a given integer k >= 2 each node needs only consider all the nodes at distance at most k hops from it. The resulting spanner has maximum degree at most 3 + 6/pi r + r+1/r(2), when 0 < r < 1 (and at most five, when r = 1). Furthermore it is shown that the spanner is planar provided that the distance between any two nodes is at least root 1-r(2). If the spanner is planar then for k >= 2 the sum of the Euclidean lengths of the edges of the spanner is at most kr+1/kr-1 times the sum of the Euclidean lengths of the edges of a minimum weight Euclidean spanning tree.
paper_title: Local construction of planar spanners in unit disk graphs with irregular transmission ranges
